panels.description: This shows how many members are configured in the replica set.
panels.title: ReplSet Members

panels.description: This shows the time since the last election.
panels.title: ReplSet Last Election

panels.description: This panel shows how far behind in replication this member is if it is a secondary. This number may be high it the instance is running as a delayed secondary member.
panels.title: Avg ReplSet Lag

panels.description: ReplSet statuses during the select time range.
panels.title: ReplSet States

panels.description: MongoDB replication lag occurs when the secondary node cannot replicate data fast enough to keep up with the rate that data is being written to the primary node. It could be caused by something as simple as network latency, packet loss within your network, or a routing issue.

targets.expr: avg by(service_name) (max by(service_name, set) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_member_replication_lag{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$secondary",set="$replset"}[$interval]) > 0) or max by(service_name, set) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_member_replication_lag{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$secondary",set="$replset"}[5m]) > 0))

avg by(set) (max by(service_name, set) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_member_replication_lag{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$secondary",set="$replset"}[$interval]) > 0) or max by(service_name, set) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_member_replication_lag{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$secondary",set="$replset"}[5m]) > 0))

panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Operations are classified by legacy wire protocol type (insert, update, and delete only).
panels.title: Operations - $service_name

panels.description: This metric can show a correlation with the replication lag value.

targets.expr: avg by(service_name, name, state) (mongodb_mongod_replset_member_ping_ms{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"}) * on(name) group_right(state) avg by(service_name, state, name) ((max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit"}[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit"}[5m])))

panels.title: Max Member Ping Time - $service_name

panels.description: Time span between now and last heartbeat from replicaset members.

targets.expr: time() - avg by(service_name) (max by(name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_member_last_heartbeat{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})) * on(name) group_right() avg by(service_name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})

avg by(service_name) (max by(name) (mongodb_rs_heartbeatIntervalMillis{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"}) / 1000) * on(name) group_right() avg by(service_name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})

panels.title: Max Heartbeat Time

panels.description: Count of elections. Usually zero; 1 count by each healthy node will appear in each election. Happens when the primary role changes due to either normal maintenance or trouble events.
panels.title: Elections

panels.description: Timespan 'window' between newest and the oldest op in the Oplog collection.
panels.title: Oplog Recovery Window - $service_name

panels.description: Repl buffer ops applied per sec.
panels.title: Oplog Buffered Operations

panels.description: Time spent per second waiting for or fetching oplog docs in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Getmore Time

panels.description: Times spent per second A) pre-loading oplog ops into parallel-executable batches B) Times spent pre-loading index values and C) repl batch apply phase.
panels.title: Oplog Processing Time - $service_name

panels.description: Current hard-coded max and actual size of repl batch buffer.
panels.title: Oplog Buffer Capacity - $service_name

panels.description: Count of A) getmores executed B) index values pre-loaded C) oplog docs applied per second against oplog collection in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Operations - $service_name

patterns.name: Uptime
patterns.tooltipTemplate: The parameter shows how long a service has been up and running without a shut down or restart.

patterns.name: Open Connections
patterns.tooltipTemplate: Connects to a MongoDB instance and to a specified database on that instance.

patterns.name: Cursors
patterns.tooltipTemplate: When the db. collection. find () function is used to search for documents in the collection, the result returns a pointer to the collection of documents returned which is called a cursor.

targets.expr:
avg by (service_name) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m]))

avg by (service_name) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name",state="total"}[5m]))

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command).
panels.title: Latency Detail - $service_name

panels.description: Docs per second inserted, updated, deleted or returned. (N.b. not 1-to-1 with operation counts.)
panels.title: Document Operations - $service_name

panels.description: MongoDB keeps most recently used data in RAM. If you have created indexes for your queries and your working data set fits in RAM, MongoDB serves all queries from memory.
panels.title: Cache - $service_name

panels.description: The CPU time is measured in clock ticks or seconds. It is useful to measure CPU time as a percentage of the CPU's capacity, which is called the CPU usage.

targets.expr: clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[$interval]) or avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[5m]))),100)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_system_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="system"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="system"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="system"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="system"}[5m]))),100)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_user_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="user"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="user"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="user"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="user"}[5m]))),100)

panels.title: CPU Usage - $node_name

panels.description: When a system is running with maximum CPU utilization, the transmitting and receiving threads must all share the available CPU. This will cause data to be queued more frequently to cope with the lack of CPU. CPU Saturation may be measured as the length of a wait queue, or the time spent waiting on the queue.

targets.expr:
((sum(avg_over_time(container_processes{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]))-1) / avg by () (machine_cpu_cores)) or
avg by () ((avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node_name=~"$node_name"}[$interval])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node_name=~"$node_name"})) or (avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node_name=~"$node_name"}[5m])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node_name=~"$node_name"})))

clamp_max(sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5m])) or
max by () (sum  by (cpu) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[5m]),1)) )),1)

panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage - $node_name
